definition: to ascertain/to act on/to criticize/to pass on/classifier for batches, lots, military flights/tier (for the ranking of universities and colleges)
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

sentences.english: The company doesn't need to keep inventory! unlike its competitors in online rettroubled.
sentences.chinese: 不像其它線上批發業的競賽者，該公司不必要有庫存。

sentences.english: China′s industrial consumables wholesale business is the breakout of the circulation system reform.
sentences.chinese: 我國工業消費品批發業，是流通體制改革的突破口。

sentences.english: Retail and wholesale trade, at 12 percent, was slightly lower than in 1980.
sentences.chinese: 零售和批發業佔12%，比1980年略低。

sentences.english: The wholesale industry is facing the increasingly urgent transition problem.
sentences.chinese: 批發業面臨日趨緊迫的轉型問題。
